item.title: Windows 11 tests sharing apps screen and files with Copilot AI
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Copilot on Windows 11 is testing OS-level integration that would allow you to share your favourite apps' screen with Copilot. [...]

item.title: Google takes on Cursor with Firebase Studio, its AI builder for vibe coding
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google has quietly launched Firebase Studio, which is a cloud-based AI-powered integrated development environment that lets you build full-fledged apps using prompts. [...]

item.title: Hackers target SSRF bugs in EC2-hosted sites to steal AWS credentials
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A targeted campaign exploited Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerabilities in websites hosted on AWS EC2 instances to extract EC2 Metadata, which could include Identity and Access Management (IAM) credentials from the IMDSv1 endpoint. [...]

item.title: Oracle says "obsolete servers" hacked, denies cloud breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Oracle finally confirmed in email notifications sent to customers that a hacker stole and leaked credentials that were stolen from what it described as "two obsolete servers." [...]

item.title: Windows 11 April update unexpectedly creates new 'inetpub' folder
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft's April 2025 Patch Tuesday updates are strangely creating an empty "inetpub" folder in the root of the C:\ drive, even on systems that do not have Internet Information Services (IIS) installed. [...]

item.title: Critical FortiSwitch flaw lets hackers change admin passwords remotely
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Fortinet has released security patches for a critical vulnerability in its FortiSwitch devices that can be exploited to change administrator passwords remotely. [...]

item.title: CentreStack RCE exploited as zero-day to breach file sharing servers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers exploited a vulnerability in Gladinet CentreStack's secure file-sharing software as a zero-day since March to breach storage servers [...]

item.title: Microsoft investigates global Exchange Admin Center outage
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is investigating an ongoing outage that is blocking admins worldwide from accessing the Exchange Admin Center (EAC). [...]

item.title: Who's calling? The threat of AI-powered vishing attacks
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
item.description: AI is making voice phishing (vishing) more dangerous than ever, with scammers cloning voices in seconds to trick employees into handing over their credentials. Learn how to defend your organization with Specops Secure Service Desk. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: April 2025 updates break Windows Hello on some PCs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says some Windows users might be unable to log into their accounts via Windows Hello after installing the April 2025 security updates. [...]

item.title: Phishing kits now vet victims in real-time before stealing credentials
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Phishing actors are employing a new evasion tactic called 'Precision-Validated Phishing' that only shows fake login forms when a user enters an email address that the threat actors specifically targeted. [...]

item.title: Police detains Smokeloader malware customers, seizes servers
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: In follow-up activity for Operation Endgame, law enforcement tracked down Smokeloader botnet's customers and detained at least five individuals. [...]

item.title: Fake Microsoft Office add-in tools push malware via SourceForge
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat actors are abusing SourceForge to distribute fake Microsoft add-ins that install malware on victims' computers to both mine and steal cryptocurrency. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes auth issues on Windows Server, Windows 11 24H2
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has fixed a known issue causing authentication problems when Credential Guard is enabled on systems using the Kerberos PKINIT pre-auth security protocol. [...]
